page.title: 08HOUSING SCRAPTOFT THURNBY
page.content: Most of the houses in our area are less than 30 years old,but some cottages in the villages are hundreds of years old. The oldest buildings are the churches dating back to the 13th century. Most people live in semi- detached or detached houses,but there are some modern bungalows and old folks bungalows.There are two homes for old folk .There are no high rise flats at all,but a few maisonettes.The Thurnby Lodge Estate was built by Leicester City Council about 30 years ago and private buiders have been building other estates since.The latest development started this year will provide another 180 homes.For the past few years tenants have been able to buy their council houses and many have done so.
